title: Pipeline board becomes unresponsive with more than 200 deals
description: When a sales team has more than 200 active deals in the pipeline, the kanban board view becomes extremely slow and unresponsive. Dragging deals takes 3-5 seconds, and scrolling is janky. This impacts large sales teams and makes the feature unusable for enterprise customers.

reproductionSteps.step: Log in as a user on a team with 200+ active deals
reproductionSteps.actualResult: Pipeline board takes 8-12 seconds to load and render all deal cards

reproductionSteps.step: Attempt to scroll through the pipeline stages
reproductionSteps.actualResult: Scrolling is janky, dropping to 15-20fps, noticeable lag

reproductionSteps.step: Drag a deal card from one stage to another
reproductionSteps.expectedResult: Card follows cursor smoothly, drop completes within 500ms
reproductionSteps.actualResult: Card lags behind cursor by 1-2 seconds, drop operation takes 3-5 seconds to complete

reproductionSteps.step: Filter the pipeline to show only 50 deals
reproductionSteps.expectedResult: Performance should improve with fewer deals visible
reproductionSteps.actualResult: Performance improves slightly but still not acceptable, suggesting rendering issues even with hidden elements

additionalDetails.networkConditions: Problem occurs even on fast connections
additionalDetails.deviceSpecs: Tested on high-end laptops (16GB RAM, modern CPUs)
additionalDetails.affectedTeams: Enterprise customers with 200+ deals, approximately 15% of user base

rootCause: All deal cards are being rendered in the DOM simultaneously without virtualization. React is re-rendering all 200+ cards on every state change (filters, drags). No memoization on card components. Drag-and-drop library (react-beautiful-dnd) has performance limitations with large lists.
